description: Sunlit promenades, salty air, and effortless glamour—soundtrack for chic French resort escapes.

items.name: Domaine des Sources
items.description: This South of France resort is only 75 km from the Provence airport. Set in the beautiful countryside, the place offers all the modern amenities you would expect from a five star establishment. The seasonal pool and the golf greens on the premises are the perfect way to spend your holiday. The Domaine des Sources is the best pick of resorts in France for many travelers.

items.name: Les Domaines de Saint Endreol Golf & Spa Resort
Auberge des Pins
items.description: The studio and guest rooms have their own private terrace areas and the resort is the perfect place to woo your significant other! There are two outdoor pools, tennis courts and also a common terrace area where people sunbathe or just sleep. The terrace also has the renowned Auberges restaurant where you can have authentic French food. Certainly one of the most laid back resorts in France!

items.name: Les Tourelles
items.description: Les Tourelles is one of the cozier seaside resorts of North France. The hotel stands in stark contrast to the enormous sand beaches of Baie de Somme in Normandy, its red brick exterior and turrets exuding a Grimm brothers charm. One of the first all-inclusive beach resorts in France to go eco friendly, the place has stylishly decorated spacious rooms in addition to several pools inside the place.

items.name: Château de la Chèvre d’Or
items.description: This seaside resort may be one of the best kept secrets of France. The gem of luxury resorts in France and frequently figuring on top French resorts list, this place has the most gorgeous views of the sea from the rooms as well as the restaurants. The the resort is complete with a spa, an outdoor pool as well as a bar. Les Ramparts, the resident restaurant here specializing in seafood, is rated two Michelin stars so get ready to get your gourmet on here!
